intro: Moricandia foleyi, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. It is typically found growing in sandy or rocky soils, often in desert or semi-desert environments. Moricandia foleyi is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
